children.subject:
I took Stat 135 and CS 189 concurrently. Stat 135 is a survey course in statistics, it covers parameter estimation (i.e. you have some observations, you believe they follow a Poisson(lambda) distribution, let us find lambda), hypothesis testing (null hypothesis: lambda = 1, alt hypothesis: lambda = 2, which one should we accept based on the data), linear regression (there is so much more to linear regression than covered in 189, this class covered it for three weeks or so) and a little of Bayesian parameter estimation.

If you are interested in statistics overall, this class will give you a flavour for it. There is not much overlap with CS189 except for the fact that both are heavy in statistics. You will learn more about MLE in this class.

Also, 135 (at least with Prof. Lucas) is not very theoretical, but mostly centered around applications.

history.content:
I was wondering if there is any overlap between these two courses ?

Would there be any benefit in taking Stat 135 this semester after CS189 (took it last semester with prof Malik and prof Listargen) if I am interested in learning more about statistical theory ?
history.subject: Overlap in CS189 and Stat135
